meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: F.D.A. to Assess Safety Of Drugs at 18 Months The Food and Drug Administration announced a 30-point plan to ensure that marketed drugs are as safe as advertised, including the first attempt to assess the safety of drugs 18 months after introduction. It also announced an advisory panel to improve the way that it announces safety worries. PAGE A17

A Violent Holy Day in Iraq More than 50 people were killed in attacks across Iraq, mostly directed at Shiites, who were commemorating the seventh century martyrdom of the Prophet Muhammad's grandson at the hands of Sunnis. PAGE A10
Managing the Unexpected A video clip of Hillary Rodham Clinton singing may have been trivial, but the episode illustrated how technology can drive political news in unexpected directions. PAGE A15
Details of Spitzer's Budget Gov. Eliot Spitzer will propose a budget of more than $120 billion today that would increase overall spending by more than 6.3 percent but reduce property taxes. PAGE B1

Winter Sunshine With winter having finally arrived, the sunny presence of lemons is more welcome than ever. And cooking and baking with lemons brings bright flavors often missing in other cold-weather foods. DINING, PAGE F5

A Changing Battle on AIDS Is Reflected in a Quilt The creator of the AIDS Memorial Quilt is locked in a legal tug of war with the quilt's caretaker, the Names Project Foundation, over custody of 35 of its 6,000 panels. Above, quilt panels in storage in an Atlanta warehouse. PAGE A16
Editor Returns to The Times Dean Baquet, the editor of The Los Angeles Times who was fired for refusing to cut jobs, is returning to The New York Times. PAGE A13

Clues to Stonehenge Builders New excavations near Stonehenge have uncovered hearths, timbers and other remains of what archaeologists say was probably the village of workers who erected the ancient monoliths in England. PAGE A11

F.D.A. to Assess Safety Of Drugs at 18 Months The Food and Drug Administration announced a 30-point plan to ensure that marketed drugs are as safe as advertised, including the first attempt to assess the safety of drugs 18 months after introduction. It also announced an advisory panel to improve the way that it announces safety worries. PAGE A17

Editor Returns to The Times Dean Baquet, the editor of The Los Angeles Times who was fired for refusing to cut jobs, is returning to The New York Times. PAGE A13
